samples.context: This build-up of lactic acid in our muscles during sudden activity causes cramps. It is a byproduct of anaerobic respiration, which occurs when the body needs energy quickly but cannot supply enough oxygen for aerobic respiration.
samples.question: What does lactic acid cause during activity?

samples.context: This build-up of lactic acid in our muscles during sudden activity causes cramps. It usually occurs during intense exercise when the body relies on anaerobic metabolism.
samples.question: What is lactic acid a byproduct of?

samples.context: This build-up of lactic acid in our muscles during sudden activity causes cramps. The production of lactic acid can lead to muscle fatigue and discomfort if not cleared quickly from the muscles.
samples.question: What is one effect of lactic acid on muscles?

samples.context: This build-up of lactic acid in our muscles during sudden activity causes cramps. The body produces energy through anaerobic respiration when there is insufficient oxygen available.
samples.question: When does lactic acid build up in muscles?

samples.context: This build-up of lactic acid in our muscles during sudden activity causes cramps. It's important for athletes to manage lactic acid levels to improve performance and comfort during exercise.
samples.question: Why should athletes manage lactic acid?
